review: So far, so great.  Pop it into the hdmi port on the tv, run through the set up and that's it.
author: LSGold

review: Once I got through the initial installation on my tv, I was pleased with the Fire TV Stick.  It kept searching for my remote and I had to unhook it a couple of times before it took.  My tv doesn't have a USB port, but the included cable worked with my HDMI port.  The remote is very nice, although difficult to open to get the batteries inside.  I had to search for a Youtube video to get directions for something that should have been easy.  It took a flathead screwdriver to pop it open.  I like being able to scan through the choices available and like that I can pick back up where I left off if I can't watch an entire show.
author: Heidi N.

review: It's is great when it works but it loses connection in the middle of a movie.  Nothing else in our house loses connection, we can watch Netflix and Prime on our wii or laptop with no issues.
author: LuAnn Eitner

review: It started quickly, but the video I was watching was paused frequently. I was only able to watch one video when the network connection failed.  I will try again with the "pigtail" plug .  Since I watch at bedtime the first go was frustrating so I unhooked and returned to cable viewing until I have the patience to fiddle with it.  I was hoping for the easy access Apple TV provides.  At this time disappointing.
author: Marilyn Kitson

review: Be forewarned if you have a smart TV you don't need this. Also if you have a TV with a DVD player built in this won't work on it. It took us three calls to customer service to have this be determined. Extremely frustrated with customer service but this seems to be typical that not all agents seem to have to knowledge to access the same information so they can help you the first time.
author: P. Elson "Avid Reader"

review: Couldn't find much to watch that didn't take upgrading to Amazon prime, so I signed up for that, then the fire stick started scrolling on its own.  I couldn't control it with the remote, so I unplugged it.  The stick was very warm to the touch, and I haven't used it since.....
author: Bob
